name: dynamic_allocation_issue_in_spark_executors
description: Dynamic allocation in Spark executors refers to the feature that allows the cluster to allocate and deallocate resources at runtime based on the workload. This feature is designed to optimize the cluster's resource utilization by dynamically adjusting the number of executors based on the workload. However, if the dynamic allocation is not working as expected, it can cause performance issues and hinder the overall efficiency of the cluster. Troubleshooting and optimizing dynamic allocation is necessary to ensure that the cluster is functioning optimally.

cells.name: cell_1
cells.content:
## Dynamic allocation issue in Spark executors.
Dynamic allocation in Spark executors refers to the feature that allows the cluster to allocate and deallocate resources at runtime based on the workload. This feature is designed to optimize the cluster's resource utilization by dynamically adjusting the number of executors based on the workload. However, if the dynamic allocation is not working as expected, it can cause performance issues and hinder the overall efficiency of the cluster. Troubleshooting and optimizing dynamic allocation is necessary to ensure that the cluster is functioning optimally.

cells.name: cell_2
cells.content: ## Check if Dynamic Allocation is enabled

cells.name: cell_3
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `grep spark.dynamicAllocation.enabled ${SPARK_CONFIG_FILE}`

cells.name: cell_4
cells.content: ## Check if Executor Memory is set

cells.name: cell_5
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `grep spark.executor.memory ${SPARK_CONFIG_FILE}`

cells.name: cell_6
cells.content: ## Check if Driver Memory is set

cells.name: cell_7
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `grep spark.driver.memory ${SPARK_CONFIG_FILE}`

cells.name: cell_8
cells.content: ## Check if spark.shuffle.service.enabled is set to true

cells.name: cell_9
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `grep spark.shuffle.service.enabled ${SPARK_CONFIG_FILE}`

cells.name: cell_10
cells.content: ## Check if the number of executor cores is set

cells.name: cell_11
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `grep spark.executor.cores ${SPARK_CONFIG_FILE}`

cells.name: cell_12
cells.content: ## Check if the number of Executors is set

cells.name: cell_13
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `grep spark.executor.instances ${SPARK_CONFIG_FILE}`

cells.name: cell_14
cells.content: ## Check if the Spark Event log is enabled

cells.name: cell_15
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `grep spark.eventLog.enabled ${SPARK_CONFIG_FILE}`

cells.name: cell_16
cells.content: ## Check if the Spark Event log directory is set

cells.name: cell_17
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `grep spark.eventLog.dir ${SPARK_CONFIG_FILE}`

cells.name: cell_18
cells.content: ## Check if there are any errors in Spark logs related to Dynamic Allocation

cells.name: cell_19
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `grep "DynamicAllocation.*error" ${SPARK_LOGS}`

cells.name: cell_20
cells.content: ## Insufficient resources such as memory and CPU on the Spark cluster causing the dynamic allocation to fail.

cells.name: cell_21
cells.content: host | host_name=$HOST_NAME | invoke_spark_cluster_resource_check($MINIMUM_CPU_THRESHOLD, $MINIMUM_MEMORY_THRESHOLD)

cells.name: cell_22
cells.content: ## Consider increasing the number of nodes in the Spark cluster to provide more resources for dynamic allocation.

cells.name: cell_23
cells.content: host | host_name=$HOST_NAME | invoke_edit_spark_cluster_config($NEW_NUMBER_OF_NODES, $SPARK_CONFIG_FILE, $PATH_TO_SPARK_HOME)
